marketNews.title: IHSG +5.5% This Week, Starting to Show Signs of Recovery
marketNews.content: The IHSG strengthened by +5.5% since the beginning of this week as of Thursday (6/3), after being in a bearish trend with a decline of -21% from its recent peak in mid-September 2024. The strengthening of the IHSG this week raises questions as to whether its downtrend is over and if a rebound can continue, or if it has the potential to fall again. We try to look at historical data of IHSG movements to answer this question. Here are some of our key findings: 1. Historical Average and Range of Decline Similar to Current Decline Level. In the last 20 years, there have been 8 incidents where the IHSG experienced a significant decline. The definition of significant we use is a minimum decline of 15%. Of these incidents, 2 cases were caused by massive crisis declines, namely the Covid-19 pandemic (-38.4%) and the Global Financial Crisis (-61.6%). Excluding these 2 crises, the average decline of the IHSG from the other 6 incidents was -21.4%, with a decline range between 15.8-26.9%. 2. Full Rebound. Out of 8 decline incidents, the IHSG successfully rebounded to the level before the decline occurred, although with a longer duration than the decline duration. There were even 5 incidents where the IHSG managed to rebound to exceed the level before the decline occurred. 3. Trade War Volume I. The IHSG also succeeded in rebounding from the decline related to the first volume trade war during the February-July 2018 period, where this incident has similarities to the current condition. Important notes and disclaimer: - There are 2 significant decline incidents excluded, namely in the 2005 and 2006 periods. This exclusion was made because the IHSG nominal during those periods was below 2,000, so the relevance of the decline was less comparable to the 8 IHSG decline incidents in our table. - Measurement of decline and rebound may contain subjectivity in chart observation. - There is no certainty that the current decline will not turn into a crisis which historically has a massive level of decline. Key Takeaway As a conclusion, if investors assess that the current condition is not a crisis and the prospect of a crisis occurring is not large, history shows that the current IHSG decline has reached/is approaching its end and has the potential to be followed by a significant rebound. *This article was previously published in Stockbit Commentary on Wednesday (6/3) afternoon.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Acquires 39.7 Million PTRO Shares
tickerNews.content: $CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 39.7 million shares of PTRO at an average price of 3,026 rupiah per share on March 4-5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 120 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Kreasi Jasa Persada in PTRO increased from 41.519% to 41.913%.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Sells Shares in RATU, Cross Transaction Occurs
tickerNews.content: $RATU: The controller of Raharja Energi Cepu, Rukun Raharja ($RAJA), sold approximately 126.5 million RATU shares on March 5, 2025, with an undisclosed transaction value. Following this transaction, RAJA's ownership in RATU decreased from 80% to 75.34%. On the same day, there was a negotiated transaction (crossing) of RATU shares valued at 149 billion rupiah, consisting of approximately 130 million shares at an average price of 1,175 rupiah per share, which was 80% lower than the closing price of RATU shares on the stock exchange that day at 5,975 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Acquires Shares in SCMA
tickerNews.content: $SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased approximately 74.3 million SCMA shares at an average price of 202 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 15 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 62.72% to 62.82%.

tickerNews.title: IMJS Plans Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: $IMJS: Indomobil Multi Jasa plans to hold a rights issue of up to 3 billion new shares with the exercise price, ratio, and dilution effect yet to be announced. The proceeds from this corporate action are intended to strengthen the company's capital structure and develop its business. This plan will be discussed in the GMS on April 14, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ESSA prepares Capex US$20 Million for 2025, Blue Ammonia and SAF Projects Timeline Set
tickerNews.content: $ESSA: The President Director of ESSA Industries Indonesia, Kanishk Laroya, stated that the company's blue ammonia project is currently in the feasibility study stage, targeting construction commencement in 2027 and commissioning in 4Q28. The sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) project is planned to enter the construction stage in 2026 and commissioning in 1Q28. Later, the SAF plant will have a production capacity of 150,000 tons per year. For 2025, ESSA allocates a capex of US$20 million, entirely sourced from internal cash and designated for routine ammonia plant maintenance.

tickerNews.title: ABMM Cancels Acquisition of Two CTBN Subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: $ABMM: ABM Investama announced that the company has canceled the acquisition of two subsidiaries of Citra Tubindo ($CTBN), namely PT Sarana Citranusa Kabil and PT Citra Pembina Pengangkutan Industries. Previously, ABMM through its subsidiary, PT Cipta Krida Bahari, had signed an agreement to acquire these 2 companies in November 2024, but the plan was canceled after the company "discussed and reconsidered" the transaction.

tickerNews.title: NSSS President Director Purchases Millions of Shares
tickerNews.content: $NSSS: The President Director of Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera, Teguh Patriawan, purchased approximately 46.9 million NSSS shares at an average price of 240 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 11.2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Teguh's ownership in NSSS increased from 10.293% to 10.485%.

tickerNews.title: DRMA Q4 2024 Net Profit Reaches 167 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $DRMA: Dharma Polimetal recorded a net profit of 167 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+81% YoY, -4% QoQ). This result brings the net profit for 2024 to 579 billion rupiah (-5% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 101% of the consensus estimate. The year-on-year surge in net profit in 4Q24 was mainly due to a low-base effect. Meanwhile, the net profit for 2024 only decreased by -5% YoY as solid growth in the motorcycle segment revenue (+12% YoY) could compensate for the decline in car segment revenue (-21% YoY). Throughout 2024, the gross profit margin for the motorcycle segment (22%) was higher than the car segment (13%).

tickerNews.title: ARKO President Director Purchases Over 1 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $ARKO: The President Director of Arkora Hydro, Aldo Henry Artoko, purchased approximately 1.04 million ARKO shares at an average price of 928 rupiah per share on March 3-5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Aldo's ownership in ARKO increased from 0.11% to 0.14%.

tickerNews.title: YUPI Plans IPO, Offering Up to 10% Stake
tickerNews.content: Yupi Indo Jelly Gum ($YUPI) plans an IPO by offering up to approximately 854.4 million (10%) shares, which consists of approximately 256.3 million (3%) new shares and approximately 598.1 million (7%) divestment shares from PT Sweets Indonesia as the company's controller. The offering price ranges from 2,100-2,500 rupiah per share, so the maximum proceeds for the company from this corporate action reach 640.8 billion rupiah. Of this amount, 77% will be used for capex to build a factory in Nganjuk, East Java, which is estimated to operate no earlier than 2026, while the remaining 23% is for working capital. The public offering period is estimated to take place on March 17-19, 2025, with an estimated listing on March 21, 2025. Previously, YUPI shareholders - namely, PT Sweets Indonesia and Daniel Budiman - signed an agreement to divest their entire post-IPO shareholding at an undisclosed value to PT Confectionery Consumer Products Indonesia, an entity owned by the private equity firm Affinity.

tickerNews.title: Fore Coffee Plans IPO in April 2025 targeting at least 300 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that East Ventures plans to bring the Fore coffee chain for an IPO as early as April 2025 with a funding target of at least 300 billion rupiah, which would give Fore a market cap of 1.8 trillion rupiah. Bloomberg sources stated that the proceeds are intended for expansion, although details regarding the size and timing of the IPO may still change. Fore shareholders - including East Ventures - are also reportedly not planning to sell their shares in the IPO. Fore itself was founded in 2018 and currently has more than 200 outlets in 44 cities in Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: DME Investment Requires US$11 Billion, Royalty Exemption for Downstreaming Coal Projects
tickerNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of ESDM, Tri Winarno, stated that the dimethyl ether (DME) investment in the downstreaming project to be funded by the Danantara Investment Management Agency requires a cost of US$11 billion. This amount is equivalent to 27.5% of the total investment for 21 downstreaming projects that were previously reported to be funded by Danantara at US$40 billion. The DME project itself is a coal downstreaming process to produce LPG fuel. Kontan reported that the DME project has the potential to reduce state revenue, considering the Omnibus Law regulation signed by Joko Widodo during his term will exempt royalties for coal companies that carry out downstreaming. Previously, in 2023, a foreign investor, Air Products and Chemicals Inc., withdrew from the coal gasification project with Bukit Asam ($PTBA).

tickerNews.title: IDX Proposes to OJK to Reopen Non-Real-Time Broker Code and Investor Domicile
tickerNews.content: IDX Director, Irvan Susandy, stated that they are submitting a plan to OJK to reopen broker codes and investor domiciles in a non-real-time manner, following input conveyed by market participants early this week in discussions. Previously, IDX closed broker codes and investor domiciles in December 2021 and June 2022, respectively, with the consideration of lowering stock trading spreads and protecting investors from selling and buying pressure.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Manpower Proposes THR for Online Motorcycle Taxi Drivers in Cash Form
tickerNews.content: Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, stated on Wednesday (5/3) that the government proposes that holiday allowance (THR) for online motorcycle taxi drivers (ojol) be given in cash form. Nevertheless, the final formula for ojol THR payment is still being discussed with relevant stakeholders.

tickerNews.title: US Withdraws from JETP, Originally Pledged over US$3 Billion to Indonesia and Vietnam
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the US is withdrawing from the Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP), a collaboration between rich countries to help developing countries transition from coal to cleaner energy. The US is one of the 10 donor countries in JETP, which was first launched in 2021. Indonesia, South Africa, Vietnam, and Senegal are the initial countries benefiting from JETP in the form of loans, financial guarantees, and grants. Reuters reported that the total US commitment to Indonesia and Vietnam in JETP reached over US$3 billion, most of which was channeled through commercial loans.

tickerNews.title: US Exempts Cars and Spare Parts from 25% Tariffs for Mexico and Canada for One Month
tickerNews.content: White House Press Secretary, Karoline Leavitt, said on Wednesday (5/3) that the US government exempted cars and spare parts from the 25% import tariff imposed on Mexico and Canada for one month. The announcement came just one day after the US imposed import tariffs on Mexico and Canada, and followed up on the statement by the US Trade Representative, Howard Lutnick, who mentioned that the US government could announce tariff relief for goods covered under the US-Mexico-Canada Free Trade Agreement (USMCA). The deferral also came after the US government met with leaders from Ford Motor Co. (NYSE: F), General Motors Co. (NYSE: GM), and Stellantis NV (NYSE: STLA) on Tuesday (4/3).

tickerNews.title: WTI Oil Futures Fall 3% Amid Rising US Inventories and OPEC+ Output Hike Plans
tickerNews.content: WTI crude oil futures for the April 2025 contract fell -3% to US$66.21 per barrel on Wednesday (5/3), marking the lowest level since mid-November 2024. This price decline occurred along with the release of US crude oil inventory data which increased by 3.6 million barrels to 433.8 million barrels in the week ending February 28, 2025, exceeding consensus expectations which only anticipated an increase of 341,000 barrels. The significant increase in US crude oil inventories occurred amidst the escalation of the trade war, which increased concerns about slowing economic growth and energy demand. The downward sentiment for oil prices also came from OPEC+ which will proceed with production recovery plans starting April 2025, marking the organization's first production increase since 2022. Based on Reuters estimates, this production recovery will increase OPEC+ output by 138,000 barrels per day.

tickerNews.title: Kejagung Denies Involvement of Erick Thohir and Boy Thohir in Pertamina Corruption Allegations
tickerNews.content: Head of the Legal Information Center of the Attorney General's Office, Harli Siregar, stated on Wednesday (5/3) that he denied rumors that the Minister of BUMN, Erick Thohir, and the ultimate beneficiary of Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO), Garibaldi 'Boy' Thohir, were involved in alleged corruption cases within PT Pertamina subsidiaries. Previously, a video circulated on social media narrating that the Attorney General's Office had successfully collected evidence of financial records and other documents stating the involvement of Erick Thohir, Boy Thohir, and several other influential figures to ensure coordination security in the corruption case.

tickerNews.title: WSKT Expects Net Loss of 3.97 Trillion Rupiah in 2025 Due to Decline in Government Infrastructure Projects
tickerNews.content: President Director of Waskita Karya ($WSKT), Muhammad Hanugroho, stated that they expect a net loss of 3.97 trillion rupiah during 2025 (vs. 2024: net loss of 3 trillion rupiah) following a decline in infrastructure projects from the government.
